Friends

class CodecManager

Detailed Description

Abstract audio encoder base class. The sub-classes of this class provide the actual audio encoder functionality API. The AudioEncoder sub-class instances are accessed by the clients via the CodecManager API.
See also:
CodecManager::ObtainEncoder

CodecManager::ReleaseEncoder

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* AudioEncoder::CbFrameEncoded)(ResultType result, void *context, const UINT8 HUGE *in_buf, UINT32 in_buf_used, const UINT8 HUGE *out_buf, UINT32 out_buf_len)
 

Callback function that is invoked by the AudioEncoder when a frame (or more frames) has been encoded.

Parameters:
result A result (error) code: Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that has been passed to the AudioEncoder object when AudioEncoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions has been invoked.
in_buf Pointer to the audio input buffer.
in_buf_used Number of bytes of the input buffer that were used (consumed) by the encoder.
out_buf Pointer to the audio output buffer with the encoded frame.
out_buf_len Length of the encoded audio data in the output buffer (in bytes).
See also:
EncodeFrame

EncodeBuffer

RegisterCallbackFunctions

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AudioEncoder::BitAllocationMethodType
 

Bit allocation method type. It defines which parameter the bit allocation is based on.

Enumerator:
LoudnessAllocation 
SnrAllocation

Channel mode type.

Enumerator:

JointStereoChannelMode 

enum AudioEncoder::EncodingFunctionType
 

Encoding function type.

Enumerator:
EncodeBufferFct 
EncodeFrameFct 

enum AudioEncoder::ParameterType
 

Parameter type. It is used by the AudioEncoder::SetParameters and AudioEncoder::GetParameters functions.

Enumerator:
BitPool  This parameter applies to the SBC encoder. It defines the bit pool value. Bit pool is proportional to the bit-rate of operation (used for variable bit-rate encoding). Only for AudioEncoder::SetParameters function.
FilterBankBlockLength  This parameter applies to the SBC encoder. Block length for the filter bank. Only for AudioEncoder::SetParameters function.
EndOfParameterType 

Member Function Documentation

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::AllocateOutputBuffers (  UINT8 HUGE **&  out_buf_array,
UINT8 &  out_buf_count,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len,
EncodingFunctionType &  enc_fct
)  [pure virtual]
 

Allocates a number of output buffers that are used to store the encoded frames. The array will be freed (deallocated) when using AudioEncoder::Close.

Parameters:
out_buf_array On return, a pointer to the output buffer array (the elements of the array are pointers to the actual buffers).
out_buf_count Desired number of buffers to be allocated in the output buffer array. If set to 0, the default number of buffers will be allocated. On return, the actual number of buffers, i.e. the AudioEncoder adapt the number passed in by the caller if necessary.
out_buf_len On return, the actual buffer length, i.e. the AudioEncoder.
enc_fct The caller informs the audio encoder about the function that it wants to be used for encoding (since the output buffers length and number depends on the encoding funtion). On return, contains the actually used value (e.g. if the desired encoding function is not supported).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
AudioEncoder::Close

virtual void AudioEncoder::Close (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Closes and releases the audio encoder. This method should be invoked as soon as the audio encoder is not needed anymore to allow other audio encoders to access the resources.

See also:
Open

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::EncodeBuffer (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
const UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf,
UINT32  out_buf_len
)  [pure virtual]
 

Encodes an audio buffer. The input buffer shall contain at least one complete frame. This function continues encoding until there is no complete frame in the input buffer or not enough space in the output buffer. The actual encoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when the encoding process has finished, the callback function CbFrameEncoded will be invoked. Note: In the callback function the number of consumed bytes (of the input buffer) will be returned.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the audio input buffer (containing the encoded frames).
in_buf_len Length of the audio input buffer (in bytes).
out_buf Pointer to the audio output buffer (containing the encoded frames).
out_buf_len Length of the audio output buffer (in bytes).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameEncoded

Implemented in EmzSbcEncoder.

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::EncodeFrame (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
const UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf,
UINT32  out_buf_len
)  [pure virtual]
 

Encodes an audio frame. The input buffer contains always one complete frame. The actual encoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when the encoding process has finished, the callback function CbFrameEncoded will be invoked. Note: In the callback function the number of consumed bytes (of the input buffer) will be returned.
EncodeBuffer shall be preferred to this function.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the audio input buffer (containing the encoded frame).
in_buf_len Length of the audio input buffer (in bytes).
out_buf Pointer to the audio output buffer (containing the encoded frame).
out_buf_len Length of the audio output buffer (in bytes).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameEncoded

EncodeBuffer

Implemented in EmzSbcEncoder.

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::GetCapabilities (  AudioCodecCapabilities &  caps  )  [pure virtual]
 

This function is used to retrieve the capabilities of the audio encoder (AudioEncoder sub-class).

Parameters:
caps On return, it contains the capabilities.
Note: The caller has to create this object (with arbitrary values) before calling this function. The passed object is then filled with the correct values by the AudioEncoder sub-class.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::GetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [pure virtual]
 

This function retrieves the values of specified parameters in the audio encoder.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be retrieved.
values_array On return, array of the retrieved parameter values. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type. The caller has to allocate memory for this array before invoking of this function. The existing elements of the array are then filled with the corresponding parameter values by the audio encoder.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and types_array i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::Open (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Opens the audio encoder. In general, when a encoder is opened, it is reserved for the caller and cannot be used by another caller. Thus, as soon as the audio encoder is not needed anymore, it shall be released by using Close.

Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
Close

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions (  void *  context,
CbFrameEncoded  cb_frame_encoded
)  [pure virtual]
 

Register callback functions.

Parameters:
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that is valid for all callback functions registered with this instance of the AudioEncoder. This context is then passed as an argument of all callback functions invoked by the AudioEncoder.
cb_frame_encoded A pointer to a callback function that is invoked by the AudioEncoder when a frame has been encoded (and post-processed) and is ready for rendering.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::SetConfig (  const AudioEncoderParameters &  params  )  [pure virtual]
 

Configures the audio encoder.

Parameters:
params Audio encoder parameters to be set.
stream_info On return, it contains the encoded stream info.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

virtual ResultType AudioEncoder::SetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
const UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [pure virtual]
 

Sets dynamically one or more encoder parameters.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be changed. The corresponding values to be set are delivered in values_array.
values_array Array of the values to which the corresponding parameters have to be set. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and values_array, i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
